availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eliza Ann Austin Gathright (Louisville, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Married to Owen Gathright. Mother of James Richard Gathright, John Thomas Gathright, William Price Gathright, Ann America Gathright Sperry, Eliza J. Gathright Martin, Owen Gathright, Sarah Elizabeth Gathright Sperry, Alice Bradford Gathright Smith, Marta V. Gathright, and Minnie Warren Gathright Cook. Resident of Louisville, Kentucky in 1860. Owned two enslaved individuals in Louisville in1860. Mentioned in Affidavit on behalf of Mattie Johnson in Louisville in November, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/Ward 4, p. 21.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/Ward 4, p. 1.

"Kentucky's Underground Railroad: Passage To Freedom,"KET Education, https://www.ket.org/education/resources/kentuckys-underground-railroad-passage-freedom/ (accessed February 27, 2020).
"Louisville Daily Journal, 1863-09-16," Internet Archive, https://archive.org/stream/xt71ns0kvz53/xt71ns0kvz53_djvu.txt (accessed February 27, 2020).
